I got a box with salmon and halibut and a roll and soup and salad and tea and rice and it was $15. My friend's chef's choice sushi plate was really pretty - and he seemed super happy. I lived 3 blocks from this locals spot, and would love to have a local spot like this in the future!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Very sadly disappointed. I was told that this place was awesome. Came here with a couple of friends and I was not happy with my food at all. I ordered a bento box and the food that I had was just flavorless and the portions are really small. Okay so I ordered a bento box with Tempura, Chicken Kara Age, and Beef Teriyaki. The bento box includes rice, small salad, miso soup, and tea (the basics). The Tempura was not hot and crispy it was merely soft and barely crispy. On top of that the tempura sauce was flavorless, just tasted like dipping your tempura into water. The Chicken Kara Age was not even crispy, but more oily than anything else. The beef teriyaki was prolly the best of the two items, but it still lacked great flavor, probably cheap meat. 

Overall, the prices are a little steep for the portions you are getting and it is not justifiable to be paying that much for bland food. I have not tried the sushi, but I hear it's good. I will not go back because I heard that this place was good, but to my surprise it failed.
author: Michael J.

description:
Just flew into SF on a Alaskan flight from Maui and we wanted get a quick bite to eat from our friend's place on nob hill.  Found this sushi joint 1 block away on yelp and decided to give it a try.

We had a blast, great food and great service.  I got a combo plate and everything was good, wished the sashimi servings were larger. The teriyaki  halibut was delicious.  My favorite was the shrimp tempura roll!  The folks sitting next to us had a really tough time finding parking, take that into consideration.
author: Larry Y.

description:
I stopped by Sushi Rapture for a proper meal on Friday night and everything was pretty great. I love the fact that you can go the sushi route or the cooked seafood route - we decided to mix it up and went with the following:

--Miyagi oysters
--Sake nigiri
--Hamachi nigiri
--Ikura nigiri
--Halibut sashimi
--Scallops w/Garlic and Butter served on a sizzling hot plate

The oysters, hamachi and halibut were definite standouts. The scallops were also pretty great and came with miso soup, rice and stir fry bean sprout.

The restaurant stayed bustling throughout the evening, a great mix of neighborhood folk who all seemed to know Sam. Good stuff, I'll definitely be back soon!
author: phil h.

description:
So I ordered off SeamlessWeb and shortly got a call from Sushi Rapture that they actually didn't deliver to my address but would do it this time but just wanted to let me know in advance.  I just wanted to try a new place and offered to order elsewhere but the lady on the phone was really nice and said it was no problem.  I really appreciated that as I for some reason take FOREVER deciding where to order from...and I was getting hungry.

So the food comes, right on time, and man it was soooo goood!  I got the Oyako Don and Sashimi Combo.  Portions were plentyful and it all tasted very fresh.  Tasty tasty.  I will be returning there for sure!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: I've gone here a handful of times. I'd say go here on Tuesdays for happy hour, you can get $1 oysters and $2 beers/ sushi rolls. The food is alright...
author: Lainey D.

description:
This is a review of the delivery service - 

service was great, on time (although they did forget to bring the chopsticks) and delivery guy was super nice.

The food was ok - not more - but I felt it was kind of expensive for what I got. Overall - an OK experience - ill continue my quest for the best delivery sushi.
author: Jules M.

description:
I came in on a Thursday afternoon around 2pm, so they weren't that busy. It was just the proprietors and their friends who came by to hang out and buy beers. I ordered 2 Diet Cokes, the 1/2 doz. Miyagi Oyster Special, and the 2-item bento of Kalbi and Halibut. The atmosphere was a bit contemporary Japanese with traditional art and anime figures (that a geek like me would recognize off the bat) along the walls. The anime figs in question were

Kagome from Inu Yasha
Armitage III
2 Dead or Alive trading figures

There goes a display of my geekiness...  Now for the bad news. The lower portions of the walls; however, looked dirtied up with paint scratches and a bit of graffiti. They had enough seating for about 26 people it seemed.

They must have wifi in the place cuz the waitress was on her laptop most of the time instead of promptly tending to my order. The halibut was dry like foam rubber and the oysters had this not-so-fresh taste which they tried to cover up with their dipping sauce. The Diet Coke was also stale as the expiration dates on the bottom said May 6, 2008, which was a little more than a year before I made this trip in the summer of '09. And to top it all off, my check was hastily written on a post-it note. I'm never going back there again.
author: Nathaniel O.

description: This place is a great staple of nob hill and the best of the generally lukewarm sushi options in the area. I pretty much stick to salmon, tuna, hamachi +  unagi for my orders and typically get one sashimi + 1-2 rolls. All of these are high quality and delicious. Thanks sushi rapture!
author: erik l.

description:
Not terrible. Just not great. Not great food, not great value, not great service, not great (or even good) ambience.

Will you die if you eat here? No. But in this town, you can do much better somewhere else.
author: Michael J.

description: Updating my review of their to-go service. I've a had number of orders come very late (over 1 hour late). Still good quality at a fair price but its getting inconvenient.
author: Huy T.

description:
I loved it!

Best sushi I've had delivered in a long time. I will definitely be ordering from Sushi Rapture again. 

My friend and I ordered the 49rs roll, California Maki roll, the special of the night (Fig/tuna/mint deliciousness) and the Spicy Tuna. We were impressed with all of them. I highly recommend the 49rs roll. 

The only downfalls were that it took them an hour and 15 minutes to deliver to Pac Heights - although they did warn us it would take that long -  and they forgot to include the chopsticks.
author: Tamara P.

description: Nice place and food was aiiiight. $12.95 or something of that sort for a bento box dinner (terriyaki salmon, tempura, 2 pieces of california roll, rice, soup, and salad). Honestly, never got the soup! I should just take a star off now that I think about it...
author: Lily W.

description: Place is a bit small, but really nice ambiance. Stay away from the donburi - ordered an unagi don...what a rip-off! Gave me two tiny pieces of unagi and a huge plate of rice. Definitely recommend the 3-item dinner combo, yummy and good deal.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Great neighborhood spot with awesome happy hour deals. $1 oysters on Tuesdays are great.
author: Michael B.

description:
NEVER ORDER DELIVERY FROM THIS PLACE. EVER! 

Royally pissed that it was going to take 2 hours to deliver a meal when they originally stated an hour. Called them an hour and a half later and they said the food is still at the restaurant and will be here in another 20 minutes. Unbelievable. 

Not the first time they have been late but this is ridiculous. Unacceptable without a call informing about the delay. 

They offered a discount for next time but that's pretty presumptuous of them to assume there will even be a next time. Not trying to wait another 2 hours.

Sushi is average at best. Not many other options on grubhub but if I'm eating average sushi, I'd rather get it on time. 

Best be damn sure I'm telling everyone i know not to eat here.
author: V C.

description: Sushi portion sizes are very good. Fresh and creative rolls. I've enjoyed everything I've ordered from Sushi Rapture.
author: Meredith F.

description: This is my go-to sushi place for work dinner deliveries as they have food that taste great even after delivery. All the rolls have good amounts of quality fish and they have a great selection. Some of my favorites include Raider Roll (over 49ers roll, no bias promise),  Giants Roll, Cherry Blossom and Christmas Roll. The Teishoku Combo, the cooked bento like items, are also good considering the delivery. Good service too if you call them directly rather than 3rd party websites.
author: Ed L.

description:
Had take-out from here last night and was really impressed. When I pulled up to pick up my dinner, the place was tiny and almost empty, but the decor was nice, looked really clean and welcoming. Great little nook for good sushi!
My favorite thing I ordered was the 49er roll...amazing roll with scallops, salmon, avocado and lemon. All the flavors went together great! Also had good spicy tuna rolls and my friend LOVED the shrimp tempura. He said he wasn't a big fan of the soup, but I didn't try it. Prices were decent, sushi was good but I could tell it wasn't 100% fresh (I did order it at 8:30pm on a Sunday night though). 
Love that they close late on a Sunday, because I work late! Definitely coming back!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
OK, the venue is really small and it's no fancy shmancy modern hip sushi bar but you can find those type of place just about anywhere. 

Sushi Rapture has by far the best sushi I've ever had. I'm from Hawaii, I've lived in SF for 4 yrs and I visit family occasionally in Seattle so I know good seafood and this is it. Everything is fresh, I loved the OYSTERS, the different ROLLS and most of all the service. There's a lot to choose from so ask the staff what they recommend, you'll be satisfied! 

I must warn you, the portions are very small but every bite is exploding with yummy flavor.
author: Jamie Q.

description: Good sushi, not any overly original rolls but very fresh sashimi. Service was great in a cute little atmosphere. The great thing about this sushi spot is their 4-7 happy hour specials. $1 oysters and $2 hand rolls as well as specials on beers, miso, edamame, and a few other things. Definitely will be back for the oysters they were delicious.
author: Vickie B.

description: Washington and Leavenworth are both steep where they converge, but if you brave the elements on a Tuesday night then get ready for the Rapture.  $1 oysters and 2-for-1 hot Sake.  Grab a Creamy Roll and Zaru Soba to complete your rapturous Tuesday night.
author: Corey V.

description:
This place was recommended to me by a friend and it was just not a memorable experience.  I can really only remember that I was disappointed when I left.

We ordered about 3 rolls and some nigiri pieces that didn't fill us up though the price we paid one would have assumed we had our fill.  Maybe I eat more than the average bear?

Nothing to write home about.
author: Becca L.

description:
HUGE fan!

So... as the week progressed, my craving for sushi progressed (weird, i know). When it comes to the weekend, the first thing that comes to mind is sushi, almost as a reward for surviving the week.

Tonight I ordered delivery from Sushi Rapture, remembering how fresh and delicious my last order from there was a couple of weeks ago. On tonight's menu? Miso soup (so good), seaweed salad (LOVE) and the Sashimi combo for one. All of the above, incredible. The fish is so fresh and still so cold when it arrives (usually not the case with sushi delivery.. which by the way, I'm pretty sure only took about 10 minutes from the time I placed the order). 

A couple of weeks ago, I ordered the Miso Soup, the Eclipse Maki and the Sushi Combo for one (with the Tuna Maki). Everything was delicious, the Eclipse was not for me, but I read a bunch of rave reviews on it and while it seemed really fresh, I just wasn't a fan of the quail egg, it's just a personal thing, so I don't want to hate on it. But everything else was delicious.

Definitely recommend delivery for a night in.
author: Emily S.

description:
Rapture
If you happen to find yourself randomly at the intersection of Leavenworth and Washington , I highly recommend stopping into Rapture. It is small enough to feel like you are in someone's living room but big enough that you know you are at a restaurant. If you are looking for a laid back place to gran some quick sushi this would be a good call.
author: Jes V.

description: Went here for the second time tonight with my Grandpa, the first time with a friend, and both times been very pleased with the service and quality of sushi and Japanese food Sushi Rapture has to offer. I had a couple rolls and Udon the first time, and tonight, i had salmon sashimi which was delicious and fresh and a great spider roll with unagi on top, it was all amazing. We are defiantly going back and even Grandpa is happy with a new restaurant, in his neighborhood, they will deliver to his building for free and when its slow, no minimum charge, cant beat that!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Came here on a date a few weeks ago. this is the perfect setting for a weeknight date. we went in about 9pm, which was perfect... only a few tables were occupied. 

sipped some sake complimented by sapporo, popped edamame while we scanned the menu. we started with the gyoza. 

the rolls were fantastic. we shared the tempura maki, white dragon roll and the creamy roll. i recommend all of them. and there were many other things that i wanted to try, but was too full.

ok so i said i was too full for more sushi, but there was still room for mochi. my date and i shared the chocolate and the green tea. 

i can't wait to return for the rapture.
author: jamie b.

description: Delivery from Rapture was good.  They didn't take too long and it was reasonable.  I would give them a shot again to see if they can earn that 4th star.
author: Don G.

description:
I have tried the sushi, california rolls ( amazing) and some other rolls with tuna and salmon. they put a big piece of fresh and good quality fish.
The service was ok, and the best of all, is really close to our flat :)
author: Aneli C.

description:
Not impressed at all. Maybe its because I didn't do takeout??? 

Sashimi: we had the sake and the butterfish special. although they were fresh, pieces were very small, and didn't have a lot of flavor - maybe they brought in the skinny anorexic fish that day that didn't have any fat. 

Rolls: they were OK, not great - the rainbow roll had terrible quality fish wrapped around it. the Tuna looked like bad prosciutto. I had to pick out the crab meat - it was smelly and had WAY too much mayo. I did, however, enjoy the spicy tuna - contrary to the california rolls they did not use a lot of mayo. 

We'll stick with our usual sushi groove reservation.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Tonight we ordered two sashimi plates, edamame, and a spicy tuna roll. Every single thing was delicious. The sashimi was fresh and melted in my mouth, the rice was PERFECTLY cooked, the edamame was good (needed salt and I prefer it warm) and the spicy tuna roll was really punchy and creamy. We also got miso soup with the sashimi and while I had to nuke it (we got take out) it was still really, really flavorful.

I am always ordering from here. It may be a wee pricey, but that's what you get for good sushi. Delivered!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
The sushi here was fresh and ok. If you are having a sushi attack then by all means go, cuz you will not be disappointed with the fish.

Overall Experience:
The service is terrible. Lots of tension. When I was there the place was empty but the loud yelling back and forth between employees and seeming chaos was overwhelming to me. Apparently they were busy with takeout orders. My food took almost 30 minutes to get. The owner/ waitress was rude, the owner/sushi chef is loud, openly opinionated, and did not create a Japanese experience or feel in any way. 

I went 3 times and felt the same way each time. I live across the street so it was hard not to keep trying.
author: TraderOz C.

description:
I ordered sushi from here many a night when I lived across town, in North Beach. Now I live in the Inner Richmond, and I cannot justify ordering sushi for delivery in quite the same way.

The food was always just okay, despite how much I wanted to love it. Neatly packaged in plastic containers, the sushi always came to me looking somewhat sterile and meager. Somehow, black plastic boxes five times the size of the portion of the meal does that. I guess I would have done better to have dined in. I wonder if it would have tasted better.

The miso soup would be lukewarm- occupational hazard of delivery. The appetizers I would order to beef up an otherwise insubstantial meal just could not live up to the shame of my sterile little pieces of sushi.

Someday, I will dine here and hope the experience can redeem the seemingly overpriced delivery I used to order.
author: Anna S.

description:
Yelped delivery during the SuperBowl trying to avoid wings, pizza and burgers.......

Ordered 4 of the rolls from here, and spicy tuna was one of the best I've had. 

A good choice for delivery. On time, and tasty.
author: Katelyn W.

description:
The sushi here is very fresh. Best of all, the staff is VERY friendly! There are some very unique rolls--I definitely recommend the Creamy roll (tempura battered, fried scallop roll with a delicious wasabi sauce). There are also interesting Nigiri-like creations (titled Special Nigiri on the menu) that use combinations of thinly sliced fish and egg in place of rice and seaweed (e.g. The Sunrise which uses tuna, tobiko, and quail egg)

At first glance at the menu, there is very little choice for vegetarians. However, the staff are very accommodating. Although I am not vegetarian, I did come once with a friend who is. The staff were able to make several recommendation that modified rolls on the menu (e.g. the creamy roll above with tofu and cucumber instead of scallop) and created a few new ones (e.g. a yam roll) that my friend was very pleased with.

Bottom line: a great neighborhood sushi place with fresh fish and great staff.
author: Micki S.

description:
Sushi Rapture is ohh sooo yummy! 

The menu has tons of varieties. The ambiance is really awesome, and the service is exceptional! The only thing that sucks is that it's a bit pricey. Although, you definitely get a lot for your money. I recommend the tiger roll.



ps. If you plan on driving here you're out of your mind. Parking in the area is horrible.
author: Shel Z.

description: I was GOING to eat here.  I felt so lucky when I found parking right outside.  After meticulously maneuvering my car into the small space, I headed for the door of Rapture.  A waitress came out and stopped me, saying, "We need that space for our delivery drivers.  See that garage entrance?  Your car is sticking out and we need to get in there."  I said, "Actually, if you go look, my car is very small and it is not sticking out at all."  She angrily spun on her heel and walked back into the restaurant w/o a response.  I am very nice and polite.  This was uncalled for!  She was so rude, I was actually sincerely hurt.  I went back to my car, got in and drove around for 40 minutes looking for another spot.  I ended up eating elsewhere.  This reflects on their service, and I know I will NEVER eat there after being treated so poorly.
author: Emily H.

description: This update is so overdue I feel like a library patron handing over my late fines in shame. Let me make this short and straight to the point. Since moving around the corner from Sushi Rapture I have been here umpteen times. Umpteen times I have been served fresh, delicious food (sushi, sashimi, donburis of all sorts. tofu dishes, lunch specials, house maki and more) plus cold beers and warm smiles. The place has changed in a marked, marvelous way. Four "feel me" stars. I mean it.
author: wendella a.

description:
I know it's not Sushi Rapture's fault, but the week before I went here I had life-changing sushi in Hawaii. Any post-Hawaii sushi is doomed for me. Sorry.

Sushi Rapture is a little expensive and a little crowded. The fish was fresh, but I've definitely had better dragon rolls. The hamachi was just okay.

We were a relatively large party of six and the tables they sat us at made our arrangement a little awkward, but I guess they can't be blamed for trying. Since the place is small it always seems a little busy.

Overall, the experience was adequate, but there are better sushi places around.
author: Tash T.

description: Yes they deliver tasty sushi! I will have to stop by and have a sit down, I am sure it just as good.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
Wanted to try out a different local sushi place last weekend. This place was a great suprise. Its a small place so if its a weekend come in early, or if your a big group order it to go...I think the place is just right for the price.

A must try is the sushi nugget maki. Not your typical roll, it is warm and creamy like a crab ragoon.
author: justin b.

description:
I was really excited to try a new sushi place with solid reviews but I this place disappointed. I arrived a little early for dinner and the place was empty on a Thursday evening. What immediately shocked me was that the TV was showing the Republican National Convention and it was blaring. I could understand the staff wanting to watch the convention but it was probably a factor in the place being empty. Do I really want to watch John McCain fumble through a weak speech while choosing what fish delecacy I should have? The answer's "no". It was pretty hot inside the place since it was a warm September evening but I'd still expect a sushi place with raw fish hanging out to be able to keep the temperature down a bit more.

After examining the menu for quiet a few minutes I was surprised by the lack of sashimi on the menu. We ended up eating more rolls and then ordering some salmon nigiri, which was quite tasty. The service was prompt and I was tempted to give this place three stars but I couldn't because it disappointed and having the TV blaring was just tacky. The next time I'm looking for sushi in this part of town I'm definitely going back to Wayo, I love that place and their menu appeals to a salmon lovers appetite way more.
author: Bryan B.

description:
A very small restaurant in a mostly residential area, Sushi Rapture has the appearance of one of those great neighborhood secrets.  The food, while reasonably good, doesn't push it over the top.

I had quite a sampling of sushi and sashimi dishes.  Across the board, the fish was fresh, but not outstanding.  The sushi rice was more disappointing -- it was a little hard and tasted like plain rice, not the delicately flavored rice bed you'd find at a top-notch sushi-ya.  On the plus side, the presentation was very nice.  Each item came on it's own uniquely shaped and sized dish, the sprouts, sauces, pickled vegetables, et cetera that accompanied each dish were artfully arranged and eye pleasing.

All in all, if you live nearby, it's worth a visit, but I wouldn't make a trek from the opposite side of the city.  If you do go, take mass transit as parking in this neighborhood is incredibly limited.
author: Tom Y.

description:
Everyone who wrote a negative review is a liar. 

Good prices, excellent sushi, great service. Don't look for parking. Just live in the neighborhood or take the goddamn bus.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Decent Sushi...smaller portions for the price...but good! Tea is interestingly served in a Huge Goblet.  

Its kind of a small place, but cute decor.  Chefs are super friendly, and if you're a regular of the neighborhood they'll soon know you by name.

Service is excellent...and nothing beats two bottles of Saki, fresh fish, and watching the Lakers Loose on a Friday night =)
author: Gladys D.

description:
This was the first neighborhood place I visited when I moved to Nob Hill.  I had to treat my friend out to lunch after he sliced his hand open moving all my crap into my apartment.  It turned out to be a great choice -- I was able to distract his pain with good sushi, goblet-sized water glasses (very strange, yet, works), and their ginormous flat-screen TV at the corner of the sushi bar.

I've also gone here for happy hour with my roommate, gotten take-out from here, and discovered katsu donburi here.  It's a great little neighborhood spot and the service is always great.
author: Dianne d.

description:
So excited about my new favorite neighborhood sushi place! The decor is  nothing fancy, but I kinda like that in my sushi spot. No pretense, just good food. 

The service was excellent - the waitress made helpful suggestions, and even helped us make economical choices instead of pushing for more money. Good sign!

Their special rolls are AMAZING! Try the creamy roll - sooooo good!!

So happy to have a new neighborhood spot!
author: Jamie C.

description:
My first 5 star review.  I'm no one's bitch; if you want extra stars out of me you have to earn it!  And this place did...

I just moved two blocks from here, but in the vicinity of Polk street.  When I go out to eat it's normally in that direction, although I have noticed occasional small restaurants and cafe's dotted about the residential areas of Nob Hill and wondered if they'd be good.  So when I checked Yelp on my cell phone for a sushi restaurant in my neighborhood I couldn't resist trying Sushi Rapture out.

There were four of us and we entered a fairly quiet restaurant at 8:15pm (little did they know it was about to get significantly louder courtesy of the company I keep ;-0).  It's an intimate restaurant with an exciting menu and very friendly staff.  We started with some cold Saki and edamame.  I'm a fan of warm edamame and this was served cold, however that's the one and only complaint i have of this place.

With the aid of our server we ordered four different maki rolls.  The Snake Roll, combining salmon, spicy tuna and cilantro was delicious and fresh.  The creamy roll, pairing spicy tuna and scallops was a surprise recommendation.  As an Englishman in this fair land I sometimes take offense at the number of things that you people like to deep fry (see also: Paula Deen, urgh).  However, this roll is dropped in the fryer before being served to give it a crispy seaweed covered coating and it was fantastic!  The warmth just penetrates the skins and outer rice but leaves the fish cool and raw on the inside.  I would seriously order one of these at a ball game if they stuck it in a bun and called it a Tokyo Dog.

As well as our Maki, we ordered two of the Special Nigiri.  The United featured Hamachi wrapped around rice with Tobiko, Black Tobiko and Wasabi Tobiko on top.  The Pumpkin was Salmon with a Spicy Scallop dressing on top.  Both of these were amazing and unlike other sushi dishes I see in the majority of restaurants.  The flavor combinations are a mixture of the traditional and modern, which would certainly appeal to the neighborhood crowd and are perfectly executed every time.

We finished our meal with a couple of Mochi Ice Creams, mango and red bean.  The mango was wonderful palate cleanser and the red bean left a delicious chocolatey taste in my mouth for the short stroll home (downhill thankfully).

The bill came to $28 a head including tip which i think is extremely reasonable for such high quality, well presented sushi.  I will most certainly be returning, shortly I expect, and will be ordering a Tokyo Dog with a selection of the remaining Special Nigiris.
author: Nick S.

description: This a decent, small neighborhood place.  Their happy hour is fun.  Consists of $2 hand rolls (spicy tuna, salmon, salmon skin, crab, and white tuna), edamame, miso soup, beers, and hot sake.  For $2, it is hard to go wrong.
author: Plookie P.

description:
Sushi SAM will make sure your sashimi is fresh, Andrea will make sure you r seated and being serve as soon as you enter, Menu, presentation, service, =  what else do you need to ask for more??? 

However, parking is bad!!!  Great for Nob Hill Residence or ppl whom uses public transportation.  It's NOT pretty roomy here, so avoid coming here when you have family gattering(5+ ppl) -1 star for this reason......
author: evelyn y.

description: The sushi is fresh and delicious and not too pricey. Unfortunately (and it appears other have made similar complaints), if you're not a local, the service is unimpressive: slow, rude and lacking overall.
author: H. P.

description:
(Keep in mind this was a take-out order and not dine in but...)

I don't know who I have been listening to this whole time!  I had a friend or two tell me this place was nothing special, so in the two years that I have lived in and around the vicinity of Sushi Rapture, I never gave it a shot!  Bad call.  I think that is why you only ask for sushi advice from true sushi lovers and not  the Crunchy Roll Groupies.  Love you guys, but srsly.

The other day I was in the mood for some yellow tail (a typical day for me) but I did not want to get all dressed up and go anywhere, so I figured this was the perfect opportunity to get sushi to go.  I finally gave Sushi Rapture a try, and a few of us called in an order and it was ready in 20 minutes!  I would say it was on the mid to high end price for a small sushi joint, but the fish was very fresh and well worth it.

The staff is also very friendly and helps you with your order if you want any suggestions, and they don't rush you to make decisions. ;0)

Give them a try...
author: Carlyna R.

description:
One of the best sushi places in the City.  I've never been to Japan, but this has to be close to perfection.  Fresh fish, inventive rolls.  I've never even tried the other dishes, because the sushi is dynamite.

Staff is very helpful and friendly -- they keep my buddy's gluten-free soy sauce in the fridge so it's waiting for us.

Good luck getting a parking spot!
author: Dan H.

description:
Sushi Rapture is located in an area where there is NO parking, so please be aware of this. 

Fortunately, it was really impressive. We shared the tuna poki and sake clam soup for appetizers...great choices! We ordered the nigiri sushis-hamachi, uni (my FAVORITE), sake, and some rolls. The fish was extremely fresh and buttery...sooooo good that we ordered seconds. I think i had 6 small slices of uni...it made my day!
author: Eva L.

description:
This place is awesome! The staff is super friendly, the fish is one of the freshest in the city, and plus, the crowd is usually a really friendly one.

Highly, highly recommended
author: Hang E.

description: Convenience. Sushi Rapture is 1 block from my apartment. It's not the best nor the cheapest sushi, but it's convenient and reliable. Worth a stop if you live nearby, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Adam D.

description:
Horrible horrible service and food. I ordered an unagi donburi and at EVERY other Japanese restaurant I've ever been to, I've received an egg and veggies w/ my donburi. I got NONE of them on mine. So, i thought, maybe i'll try specifically requesting an egg next time and so i did. They INSISTED that they couldn't. Eh, what kind of restaurant CANNOT add an egg on top of a donburi dish! Charge me extra, i don't care. I just want a scrambled egg! NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN. I wouldn't recommend it to you either.

I want to say SR is the worst, unauthentic Japanese restaurant ever. A donburi dish is the easiest ever to make and i'm paying $13 for a dish for rice and unagi period. They don't even have the option of brown rice!
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: Felt like having sushi and it was an awkward time as most Japanese restaurants close between lunch and dinner. Looked on yelp to find this place open. My friend and I ordered tempura and gyoza appetizers, and sushi. We got 5 pieces of tempura ( zucchini, sweet potato, and a piece nori) and 2 pieces of shrimp that were not made with the same panko. My guess is that it's from costco. The gyoza was definitely from a bag and not homemade. The sushi was nothing special, the fish was average at best.
author: akemi h.

description: I've been to this place a few times since it's so close to my apartment. The waitress there is really nice and the service is usually good, but the food isn't anything to write home about. It's got all the basic stuff you might want to order and the fish is fresh, but I think the prices are a little high for what you get. I like it because the location is so convenient and it is great for satisfying a sushi craving, but if you're looking for a place that will leave an impression, this isn't it.
author: Caroline T.

description:
Reliable and quality food.  I live right down the street from this place and its my go to sushi spot in the city. Yes convenience plays into this remark but there are a lot of sushi places in the area but  still my girlfriend and I return time and time again.  
Food: Quality is top notch, never had a piece of fish that did not resemble fresh. 
Drink: Tea is good (watch out for the mugs they get hot!), Sake selection is good but limited, water chalices are great
Staff & Service: Friendly and if engaged will make suggestions. There when you need them to be. 
Facility: Its small, which isn't a bad thing but I feel like they have too many tables.  
Pricing: CHEAP given the quality
author: Tim W.

description:
Sushi Rapture is my neighborhood spot. Sushi is always fresh and if you are extra nice to Sam he will go rogue and go off the menu and create you special dishes.  I may be biased but the Katherine Special on the wall is fabulous! Salmon, Tempura pieces, Avocado, Tobiko and Mayo - what could be better!!   
Favorite Dishes:
United with quail egg
Fried Ramen Noodles
Fried Rice with Egg - not on the menu but SICK!!!!! Sooo good.
Spicy Scallop - Katherine Style - not on the menu
Short Ribs
Salmon Tataki - great flavor and fabulous with a bit of the wasabi mayo
Oyster Rapture - THE BEST!!!! Uni-Oyster-Quail Egg and a dash of special sauce
author: Katherine S.

description: Won't be ordering take-out from here anymore.  After 3 years of ordering at least once a week, I was very disappointed on how rude the owner was to me on the phone.
author: Anne L.

description:
I give this place 5 stars for its Service, Friendly, Casual yet hip atmosphere with really good food. You can sit at the bar and have a nice chat with the sushi chef and your friendly neighbors or you can sit at a table and get excellent service either way. This is operated by a sweet young couple who go out of there way to serve you great sushi and japanese. 

I should know something about service and Japanese food since I lived in Japan for 8 years. SF sushi is not the greatest but this place is pretty good and like I said you go there for the people and service as well......its all part of the dinning experienc. :)
author: Kristina A.

description:
A great little neighborhood spot with a really fab lunch special! 2 items (from a list of things like chicken teriyaki, tempura, etc.) plus miso soup, green tea, and gyoza for $7.95. Certain items cost $1 extra, but those items are usually worth it...I always get the BBQ short ribs because they're always freshly cooked and tender. The marinade doesn't overpower the taste of the meat either. 

I also love the tempura there because it's never too greasy. The only thing I didn't like was the tempura ice cream. It was really expensive for the size.

The best part is that they always make you feel welcome!
author: lindsay w.

description: Small cozy space with a younger energetic crowd in a neighborhood setting. Sat at the sushi bar with the chef/owner single handedly working the raw bar. Had great uni (sea urchin), snake roll, summer roll, and some other roll with eel. All were well wrapped and super fresh. Good prices for the quality, will definitely return. Loved the no-frills vibe and big Japanese beers.
author: Carter F.

description: Went for the $2 hand roll happy hour special. Great deal! Tried the spicy tuna, salmon skin, and white tuna rolls. Enjoyed them all and can't complain for the price.
author: Nicholas N.

description:
Loved this place. Great tiny sushi restaurant. Since we got there at about 3:30 we were able to hang with and talk with chef and owner. 

They go to the market everyday and buy fresh fish.

The sushi was amazing - very fresh, very well presented. 

It's a tiny place, at about 6 pm it started filling up fast. The locals were coming in and hugging the owners, chatting with the chef. It was an awesome experience. 

Support the good people - eat a Sushi Rapture
author: James C.

description: What a neighborhood gem!  I've lived two blocks away for over 6 years and never made it here before.  WHY NOT???  The butterfish was amazing, uni was briney and flavorful, the salmon was like velvet in my mouth.  Loved sitting at the bar with the sushi chef (sharing some sake with him) and ordering some of his fun creations (an amazing spicy/creamy scallop roll . . . perfect mix of heat from the spicy tuna and wasabi).  It was busy (including with pick-up orders . . . noted!) but not slammed.  Wonder if the City would let them put a few tables and a heat lamp outside ever . . . there IS some room on the wide sidewalk.   I will be back.
author: Amy R.

description:
Since I've moved to Nob Hill, I've been exploring as much as possible and wanting to eat at every restaurant I see. This place is four blocks from me and I can definitely see it becoming a very frequent dinner spot. I went with two of my friends and we all thought it was some really fresh, quality sushi. Very small and no-frills place. It took a really long time to get our food though, and we were one of only two tables in the place. Also, I was thrown off by the lettuce in one of my rolls....not necessary. Will definitely return though. 

PS: don't even try to look for parking over here. Just so everyone knows.
author: Jenna W.

description: Poor service. Place was empty and I didn't get my food for 30 mins. This is sushi shouldn't take that long.
author: Ammon D.

description:
Finally came into this neighborhood sushi joint located right on the cable car line.

The place is cozy.  The menu is easy to navigate and the selection is good.

The fish was fresh, presentation was done well.  

I warn that the spider rainbow roll was overpoweringly salty which the fried crab was to blame for.  It's also odd that the sushi chef is out front but the casework doesn't allow you to see him making the sushi.

Even with those two minor complaints I would still recommend this sushi joint.
author: King D M.

description:
I really enjoyed the noodle soup I got here the last time. It was a wet, rainy SF day (nothing strange there) and the soup was hot and noodle-y with egg and slices of beef. 

I've had sushi on previous visits, and though it's nothing spectacular it's pretty fresh. But, this place is decently priced, unpretentious (ahem Sushi Groove!) and the people working here are really nice. And, if you don't want to talk to your dining companions, they have flat-screen TVs.
author: Carolyn F.

description: Yummy! Just had dinner at Sushi Rapture. Food was GREAT! Everything that we had Dragon Roll (Unagi and Tempura), fresh Oysters, a couple of their specials.... **sorry don't remember their names** but all was fantastic. Definitely will go back there! :) The place is a bit small, clean and friendly service!
author: Mel L.

description:
Be the perfect stereotypical San Franciscan in four easy steps.

1. Buy a double shot non-fat latte.
2. Make Rice-A-Roni
3. Take Rice-A-Roni and Latte on the Cable Car.
4. Jump off cable car at Sushi Rapture and eat nothing but their amazing sashimi. (Walu is my favorite)

Also, it doesn't hurt to tell all the tourists that every San Franciscan does the same thing.
author: Austin M.

description: What a great neighborhood place...!  I didn't even know this place existed down the street from me but it's a good, reasonably priced sushi place without much of a wait.  And they have two of my favorite staples of Japanese appetizers - spinach salad and cold tofu...!  :-)
author: Wendy L.

description:
I've eaten here so many times its not funny.  Its close to home and on top of the hill so its hard to miss.  They have a tv or your viewing pleasures while you're at the bar.

The owner Andrea is awesome and is willing to take of you if you're good!  The food is great and they have a fine selection of beers to wash down that wasabi!  Stop by and grab some of the best sushi in town!

I love this place!!!
author: Harry H.

description:
I don't usually leave my freshly delivered meal mid-way to write a review (even though I don't feel like I'm missing much right now), however my experience with Sushi Rapture tonight was just such a let down that it's become annoying. 

At first, I was psyched that the person who answered the phone spoke great English and let me know that they do in fact deliver to the Marina. I noticed that the prices on the web-site menu were a bit high, but I figured, what the hell, maybe it's worth it. IT'S NOT. 

I ordered steamed shrimp pot-stickers, a regular salmon w/avocado roll, a rainbow roll, a special roll that has yellowtail and tuna w/avocado, and a small green salad. The mixed green salad wasn't on the menu, but I had asked for it and figured it wouldn't be more than 5 bucks considering the prices of the other salads on the menu. I also guesstimated the price of the salmon and avocado roll at around $6.00 (on the high end). I said I would pay cash. 

When the delivery man arrived (with decent timing), he didn't have an itemized list for me to look at with prices, but turned out my total was about $45.00 (no receipt). But I was hungry and again, thought "it might be worth it". ITS NOT.  

I called the restaurant to ask what the prices were for the items I ordered. Turned out, my salmon and avocado roll was $9.00!! That's crazy making. I told them that I thought it was high, and the lady on the phone told me to hold and basically put on another, much ruder, lady to let me know that they have "always done it like that". They were so unfriendly and obnoxious. I didnt expect them to change anything, but at least hear me out and maybe take into consideration that they are charging almost double of what all other sushi places are charging. 

Anyway, as for the food itself, I got it upstairs and this is what I found: 
Oil drenched (not steamed) small meek little pot stickers - I think I could have had better from a frozen bag at TJ's. 
Three rolls that looked neatly made, but when I ate them realized that the fish was warm and mushy, as was the rice - not well seasoned at all and definitely over-cooked. 
Tiny cabbage based salad - their house salad has a thick nasty mayo as the dressing. Its SO unimpressive. 

Overall, I give this place one lonesome star. If you're going to charge such high prices and think you're so swanky, have the food to back it up. I guess its back to Naked Fish for delivery...at least they're affordable and somewhat fresh.
author: Alisa M.

description:
The Rainbow Roll was nothing spectacular, but my date's Snake Roll was fantastic...thankfully, he's a sharer.  I didn't try the fresh oysters, though he enjoyed them.  

The best part about this place is that it's in my neighborhood and I can get there in a blink.  

The worse part about it is the space. It is small and can get crowded, hence not a good spot for an intimate conversation.  Not unlike the one I overheard between the people that were 7 inches to my right.  

I'll have my sushi with a side of this stranger's "weekend sexcapades wrap-up", thanks!
author: Beth G.

description: My dilemma?  I want sushi but I also don't want to put my pants on.  Poof! Sushi Rapture to the rescue.  The sushi is super fresh and delicious, and I really like the selection of traditional sushi with some more creative fun ones.  My only gripe is they delivered it so fast I actually didn't have pants on when it got here and I fell over trying to pull on a pair of gym shorts, but I won't hold that against them.
author: Kate E.

description:
This is really a neighborhood restaurant, if you don't live in the Russian Hill area, don't bother crossing town to come here, you've probably got a neighborhood sushi joint of your own.

Yeah, there's better sushi in town, but not two blocks from my home. If you come in at all regularly, the staff recognizes you. Yeah, the place is small, but I liked that, made it feel a little more intimate. Totally the place for Tuesday night cravings.

The prices are reasonable, and it has a *much* more laid back vibe than Sushi Groove and Sushi Rock. No loud music or crazy packed-in crowds.
author: Natalia M.

description:
Woah creamy roll!  You've got my number despite your questionable name.  You are delicious!  Christmas Roll, you're good too, but not as yummy as creamy, sorry.

Sushi Rapture is a very good spot - not much ambiance, but the fish is fresh, the presentation gets your mouth watering, and the prices aren't bad.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
3 1/2 stars

This is a cute neighborhood sushi restaurant. Probably seats 15 people at best. I think they only have 3 tables and a sushi bar. Not very authentic Japanese food, but definitely a fun atmosphere!

I highly suggest the lunch menu. For $7.95, you get two items (beef/chicken teriyaki, katsu, etc), includes miso soup, salad, rice & green tea. It's a steal! I had the tuna roll before (pretty small). I am not sure how I feel about their sashimi, but their bento box style menu is enough to keep me coming.
author: Elaine T.

description:
This is our neighborhood Sushi joint.  We live a few blocks away, so we either walk or have it delivered.   Parking in this neighborhood is truly impossible, so be prepared for that!

We tend to be Sushi creatures of habit, and usually get the same three rolls:

Spider Rainbow Roll
49er Roll
Snake Roll

The fish is always fresh, the service fast, and the taste amazing.  Prices are not the cheapest in town, but I think it's good value overall.
author: Peter S.

description:
This is definitely my favorite local sushi place. The service is fast and friendly. It's a no hype sort of place so you can always get a table. The best part is they also deliver. So when I am too lazy to walk up the hill 2 blocks they come to me. What's better than that?

It's not a huge place so I wouldn't recommend groups. Also parking in the area is awful so drivers beware.
author: Aubrey W.

description: Yuck! Fish is BAD here...and the washroom is DIRTY. Gross. I can only imagine how old the fish is! Don't waste your time looking for parking!
author: Sara B.

description: I suppose I'm sort of picky when it comes to sushi, and the other few sushi spots in Russian Hill are pretty awful--really shlocky atmosphere, overpriced, not the greatest quality fish. Sushi Rapture is tiny and sometimes the few staff members can get overwhelmed, but it's the best pick for sushi in the neighborhood.
author: stephanie l.

description:
I've been here three times now, and initial luster has distinctly worn off. The decor and location are cool, the fish is okay, the prices reasonable. One friend of mine swears by it, and I've even recommended it to out of town friends who ended up raving about it. 

Me, I'd probably love this place if it were my neighborhood joint, but it's not and I've been to better.
author: Geof M.

description:
I would probably have never gone to this place if it wasn't a block away from my apartment. But alas, it is.

Excellent sushi, excellent grilled fish. There are a bunch of people who just go there to hang out with the sushi "bartender," who apparenlty knows everyone in the neighborhood.

overall, a cute little place with reliable great food.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Sushi Rapture is so close to my house that it's actually unfair.

Agedashi Tofu (4.95$) - pretty good, then again I hadn't eaten anything in over a day by that point, so I think anything would have been good.

Saba Gari Maki (4.95$) - I don't like ginger.  Normally when I get saba gari maki at other places, the ginger is minimal so the taste is mainly mackerel.  At Sushi Rapture, it pretty much tastes like a ginger roll.  Mackerel has a really strong taste, so for the ginger to overpower it is pretty impressive.  Needless to say, because I don't like ginger, I don't think I'll be getting the saba gari maki again.

Hotategai nigiri (5.95$)  - I was kind of surprised.  Maybe I'm not sure what "good" scallops taste like, but the scallops here were literally tasteless and kind of soft.  A piece literally fell off as I was holding it.  I prefer more taste and more "rubbery" textured scallops.  Also kind of expensive.

Saba nigiri (4.50$) - Good stuff.  Big, thick cuts.

United "Special nigiri" (6.95$) - This was definitely the highlight of the meal.  Tobiko, black tobiko, and wasabi tobiko, sitting on a bed of rice, wrapped in hamachi.  It looked and tasted amazing.  If anything, it was almost tobiko overload because those suckers were seriously stuffed, but oh man, so so delicious.

Added some extremely poor-quality photos of my food.

I saw a lot of orders being placed for delivery and take out and their to go menu claims free delivery, so if it weren't so criminally close, I would probably be taking advantage of that.  I sat at the bar, but the empty tables looked really close together and cramped, so I'm not sure what the atmosphere would be like with people actually sitting in them.

I will be going back to this place as often as my checking account allows.
author: emilie k.

description:
Living so close is definitely adding to the greatness factor of Sushi Rapture.  It is a tiny place, but I've never had to wait for a table.  

The Nigiri and Sashimi are excellent.  For those of you who like rolls, there is a short menu, but they are excellent.  In addition, they've got tons of dinner specials that are easy on the wallet.  

They also do a ton of takeout and delivery orders, so if you don't feel like eating in, to go is wonderful!!
author: Kristin N.

description: My friend who lives in the area took me and I was glad to not have to find parking around here. Came into this pretty small shop that clean, slick, and a great neighborhood spot. Extra points for the sushi chef willing to be creative with sushi, watch/chat giants, and drink some sake. The portions are smaller than what most other sushi places offer but they arent terrible either. The are a little steep with what you get however. Had the shortribs which were excellently cooked and a few rolls that were more than filling. Throw in a beer and sake for about $50 and thats all gravy in my book.
author: James T.

description: The food here is really really good.  I recommend the Dragon roll and the Giants roll.  The staff is also very welcoming and fun.  They interact with all the customers and they love to talk sports with us.  We have a great time every time we go.
author: Natalie R.

description: Very fresh sushi!  Only downside is the service on the nights they are packed.
author: Blynn B.

description: Although I've lived a few blocks away from Sushi Rapture the past 2 years I had never tried. So glad I did! The service is quick and friendly, the food is good, and the price is right! I definitely will be frequenting Sushi Rapture when I have a hankering for sushi and don't want to go far.
author: Linda K.

description: This is a great neighborhood sushi spot. It's a little pricey, and my friend told me she was there on a cold day and it was freezing inside, but I really like it. The foods good, it's cute, and It's literally across the street from my place.
author: Julie F.

description: My favorite neighborhood sushi place. My bf and I come here often, or order food for delivery. We always get the two item sashimi with sake and hamachi.  The sushi is always fresh, the service is friendly, delivery is quick and they have the best miso soup, yum!
author: Carolyn K.

description:
-edamame was very over-cooked
-pieces of rolls were cut a bit too large
-seated quickly
-decent service
author: Nicole C.

description:
I live in the neighbourhood; I've been trying hard to like this place.  The sushi is mediocre and sometimes embarrassing.  The service is polite and cheerful and they have a sweet-ass TV but it takes too damn long to get food.

I'll try out delivery and see if that changes my perspective.
author: Ian T.

description: Great sushi and they deliver!! I've had better fresh fishies at other places in the city, but this is definitely tops for sushi delivery. I ate in house once and had some udon which was also very tasty.
author: Emily B.

description:
Nice neighborhood joint with personality overcomes glacier-like service. The folks at Sushi Rapture aren't rude or incompetent, they're just slow. But if you can deal with the methodical pace, the food, based on three visits, is worth the wait.

Highlights include the Maguro (Tuna) and Halibut sashimi appetizers and most of the Nigiri selections. I also enjoyed the special White Dragon roll and the Pumpkin roll (spicy scallop and salmon). 

As a fan of Spider rolls (softshell crab), I was disappointed since two of the three times I ordered it we were rewarded with an overcooked crab. And the Spicy Tuna roll was boring with very little fire.

The menu also features quite a number of non-sushi selections and several Teishoku combinations ... I dig the vibe and friendliness of the place, but would never consider it for a "quick" lunch or dinner ...

PS: Parking sucks, so be prepared to drive around the neighborhood a couple of times. Public transportation is a better option.
author: John M.

description:
I don't even know where to begin.  sushi is such an important meal in ones diet while living in San Francsicso.  that being said, to know good sushi is to know good food. 

it takes a special person to run and operate a place like this.  it also takes a special pallete to understand just how fresh their fish is.  Everyday Sammy heads to the local fish market. why and for how long everyday at 530am for YEARS to get the best, the freshest fish to serve you.  Dre and Sammy are the heart and soul of this establishment.  the quality of ingredients, the thoughtful preperation and the people have made this my all time favorite sushi restaurant. 

you know, i tried going to a few other spots in the city that other's raved about.  but the one thing you will notice is the quality and freshness of the fish HERE over anywhere else.  its not masked with too many sauces, only what works best. 

try the creamy roll i and sashimi platter it will change your life!!
author: Ryan M.

description: Great service and pretty good food, especially for the price. Had 3 solid hand rolls for $6. Not my favorite sushi place on the planet but it won't let you down.
author: Vince B.

description: Sushi Rapture is awesome - high quality, delicious, affordable, cute atmosphere, great staff. I dine in & take out regularly. They also catered sushi to a recent event for me (a lot of sushi), and did a fantastic job - it looked gorgeous & guests loved it. Everyone at Sushi Rapture is friendly and accommodating! Great neighborhood spot
author: traci u.

description: I've known sam and andrea ever since they worked at Taraval Okazuya in the sunset district.  Great kids!  I always order the chicken karaage, chilean sea bass, and whatever sam recommends.  The important thing about going to japanese restaurants is that you should always ask the sushi chef what is fresh.  The short rib ramen is always good as well.
author: jason g.

description:
it's like blueballs for the sushi lover. only I am a chick so maybe I can't use that word to describe my own personal experiences. 

rapture:   

   1. The state of being transported by a lofty emotion; ecstasy.
   2. An expression of ecstatic feeling. Often used in the plural.
   3. The transporting of a person from one place to another, especially to heaven.

Rapture is such a great word - don't you think? Transported into heaven; ecstasy - this is a very sensual word indeed. Unfortunately there is no rapture to be found inside. Just a lot of mayo with your rice, and an overpriced menu. Oh and it took an HOUR to get our food mind you. It wasn't worth 5 bucks let alone the more that I spent there........and to think I was all worked up about that rapture.
author: Stacy H.

description: To my friends in the know: come here to check out the ultimate chet.  You'll know it once you see it.  This place is a gem and their happy hour is pretty awesome.
author: Margaux S.

description: It's a great neighborhood sushi bar.  The chef is not Japanese but he trained making sushi by Japanese chef in Hawaii.  I am Japanese and I am so picky about rice, and I promise theirs are very good.  It's not hard to find a sushi bar who served great sashimi, but it is so hard to find one who serve great rice.  And very reasonable, too!
author: Sachiko M.

description: I used to go to this place fairly often and have always recommended it to friends as a reliable sushi option for Russian/Nob Hill....went for the first time in months last night - the food was still very good but I feel like the must have raised their prices.  $100/2ppl (5 rolls, seaweed salad, 3 beers) for a small spot with nothing too fancy and relatively slow service is too much if you ask me.
author: Ryan D.

description: If you go here, make sure to come early or you will be SQUISHED! This place is very popular (rightfully so), but pretty compact, space-wise. Everything I've ever eaten here before has been delicious, and I try to order something different every time. With a friendly, always-smiling staff, this place is definitely a SF favorite for me.
author: Kay B.

description: This place is around the corner from my house so I used to go here a lot before I discovered Wasabi and Giner, which is a little further from my place.  It is a cute little sushi joint with hip decor, flat screen tv, and bar.  They have a pretty good lunch special too.  They do have some tasty specialty rolls, but they don't have a lot to offer.  Other sushi joints have tons of choices, but I think their menu is lacking.  Overall, the price is a little much for what you get.  But neverthless, a great staple neighborhood spot to get some decent sushi.  Oh, they deliver for orders over $25 I think, which is cool.  I ordered it for delivery once for 4 people because we didn't want to walk a block, haha.  And they aren't open on Mondays which sucks.  You know when you want sushi and then you go, and it's not open, and you're like shit, now what?
author: Vanessa Z.

description: oh sushi rapture, for the last terrible year we were kept apart by awkwardness, despite my deep infatuation for your insanely fresh fish. you were the casualty of a date gone bad, and i abdicated any claims i might've had, as you were in his neighborhood. but oh happy news - the boy has moved!! reunited, and it feels SO good! and now i am getting to know you so much better - your cal roll? delicious! your sushi nugget? hysterical AND delicious! your creamy roll? extra super delicious!! sushi rapture, i think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
author: Kris G.

description: It was pure heaven. The specials are not to be missed- the seared ono is amazing, the tuna tartare was ridiculously sublime, and the creamy roll is one of my favorite things to eat. Its also a great place for vegetarians- they will design a roll for you. They also offer free delivery, with a minimum $25 purchase.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Came here once probably like last year with my family & relatives . I don't really recall exactly what we ordered but the sushi was decent . It wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special either . Their menu is kind of limited . Don't get the green tea cheesecake .. it isn't good . Wouldn't go out of my way to come to this sushi restaurant but it's not bad for people who live in the area . I like how it's small & quiet . Btw , it's really hard to find parking around here .
author: Eileen L.

description: The place is tiny but the food was fresh and delicious! I recommend the tuna sashimi. yum!
author: Elsa E.

description: I love Sushi Rapture.  The location is great, the sushi is always fresh and good, and the staff is friendly and effecient.  It's always a great experience - and it has a nice neighborhood feel to it (the place it tiny!!)
author: Andrea S.

description: This place is unreal, thank you Ms. House for showing me this spot!  Their spicy cream rolls are probably one of the best things I have ever had.  great spot in the neighborhood!
author: George M.

description:
small neighborhood restaurant, may need to sit elbow to elbow when the restaurant is filled.  no scene, comfy vibe.

we don't come here for the sushi, unless its the happy hour special of: california or new york roll w/ sake or beer for $5 ---OR---- gyoza w/ sake or beer for $5. (we go to sushi zone for sushi)

we primarily come here for the teppan yaki dish of either the chilean sea bass or the butterfish.  used to order chilean sea bass ($18.95) but lately have been ordering butterfish instead. since the butterfish is comparable in taste to my favorite fish chilean sea bass, i'm going for the better deal of $14.95.  both served on a hot sizzling iron plate with stir-fried bean sprouts, miso soup rice & green tea.  both chilean sea bass & butterfish are so tender & tastee!!!!! seems a bit oily, but have been told that its because both fish are oily in nature.
author: Cindi N.

description: The place was very small but near my place in Nob Hill.  There was barely anyone there when we got there.  They took a while to take our order despite not being busy and the staff was sitting at the counter eating when not serving us.  The sushi was very delicious (sort of small) and they served our water in some fancy bubble martini glasses.  I'd definitely come back.  The sushi is great!  You can eat her with a small group or alone.  You can also just come in and pick up the order/
author: Patrick T.

description: This place is fantastic! Reasonably priced, casual and great sushi!
author: Lisa K.

description: UMMMMMMM I go gaga for the sushi nugget (crab meat and cream cheese rolled with rice and seaweed then dipped in tempura ....yummy) I have yet to try the other tempura rolls, which they tell me are delicious. (This spicy cream roll sounds like another I will have to try.)
author: Kaitlyn W.

description:
I was never much for the raw fish prior to moving out from GA.  It seems to make a little more sense in SF, somehow.  This place is an easy walk from my apartment so the street parking (or lack thereof) is not an issue for me.  Furthermore, I like sports & there's always a game on the flat screen.  It's not what everyone thinks of when they go to eat sushi, but this is, after all, my review & I am, after all, a little red around the collar.  It's a great neighborhood establishment where everyone knows you after your first couple of visits.  I've tried a few other places since I started going to the Rapture, but I haven't found any that I prefer to it.  The fish seems fresh to me.  I always spend somewhere b/w $30-40 depending on how hungry (or thirsty) I am.  I've never had a hard time finding a seat, & I've always gotten great service.  Really, I can't think of anything to complain a/b.  A mechanical bull might be nice...

P.S.  Like I say: I'm relatively new to this game.  If anyone has any suggestions for potential Rapture slayers I'd love to hear them.  I've been to some of the more publicized spots, but I'm more @ home w/Andrea & Sam so far.
author: Jason C.

description: So I ordered Sushi from this restaurant following a recommendation from my sister (yeah shes my only friend on yelp) - and I was not impressed at all. While it was nice that they delivered to me, even though I live in Pac Heights, and the price was low, the portions were small and the food was just average. I ordered Chicken Teriyaki, tuna sashimi, and california roll - was not impressed with any of those items. Everything was just average.
author: Steve S.

description: Fantastic rolls, friendly service, small/hip setting...a great neighborhood spot.
author: A D.

description:
I wish this place would pack it up and go-away already.  Make room for something good for the neighborhood, especially since I live in the middle of the same block.
I've tried to like Sushi Rapture since they opened, and actually did for maybe the first year or so-they've been there a while now.
Quality slowly went downhill, mediocre raw fish is pretty nasty, and how pristine can the sashimi be when the Sushi Chef is constantly outside on the corner SMOKING A CIGARETTE??? Just, eeww.
Multiple times I've gone in an ordered a simple hand roll, just to keep tabs on whether things have improved or not.  Sadly, not.  The last time we tried it was for delivery a year and four months ago maybe, salmon sashimi, miso soup, some simple maki roll.  Well, one of us got food poisoning so I'm thinking I'm done with Sushi Rapture.
A lot of young hipsters feel otherwise however, and the place is often packed, so I've resigned myself to walking over to Union for some actually well cut fish by a trained Chef.
author: rabaja s.

description: Unpretentious little place. The staff is nice and the food is decent.
author: Daria G.

description: Simple.  Easy.  Good, fresh fish with good service.  Small place, but wasnt crowded when I was there.
author: Martin S.

description:
Good food, but expensive for the portions.

Seaweed salad good, but so incredibly tiny. That thing was no more than 1/4-1/2 cup of salad, but $5. Compared to my fav place, Wasabi & Ginger, the portion was laughable. I almost complained, but was too hungry.

Sashimi was good, new york roll nothin special.

However, they have a CRAZY GOOD spicy tuna roll. Chili oil and cilantro style, not creamy weird spicy mayo style. Best I've had in the city.

I'd go back for that roll - like 3 of them. So worth a trip, but didn't wow me at all.
author: Lady L.

description: Good sushi, but terrible delivery times. They usually say 1 hour, it's been an hour and a half and I'm still waiting. After calling they said it would be there in just a couple minutes...that was 15 mins ago. Nothing should take this long...
author: Zack W.

description: great little neighborhood sushi joint. Staff is friendly and if you want to watch a game, The LCD hanging from the ceiling is usually tuned to a basketball game or something. Love the yaki udon and the rolls are great.
author: Jan Michael K.

description: Great Great Great! The creamy roll is the best, I have to have it every time I go! The tempura ice cream was fabulous too. It is small, personal, and the staff is really attentive and nice. No complaints AT ALL.
author: Brenna R.

description:
My roommates and I ordered delivery from Sushi Rapture last weekend; having never tried nor so much as seen Rapture's sushi, I was operating on blind faith.

Thankfully, I'm pretty free of trust issues, and my first experience with Sushi Rapture did nothing to undercut my certitude.  I ordered the seaweed salad and my old standby, the shiitake roll, and despite their quoting us a 45 minute delivery time, our order arrived in less than 30.

My rolls were wrapped in avocado and sprinkled with sesame seeds---bonus (for my roommate, who I gave the mildly offensive green fruit to), and bonus.  The seaweed salad, served in a Styrofoam cup (?!) was delicious, and the cup served later as a handy means in which to cradle the rolls, which, without their avocado swathing, tended to fall apart between my chopsticks.
author: Hannah J.

description: Consistently good. Crudo special roll is awesome.
author: james j.

description:
A hidden gem. I'm from out of town but love to visit here EVERY TIME when on business. Just thinking of it now has my mouth watering... 

It's a very small place (maybe 14 seats total) and the decor is nothing spectacular. If you're seeking quality fresh fish - I haven't found a better spot. I recommend the tuna sushi (the basics) and the creamy roll (the unique), a tall Sapporo, the baseball game on the TV, and ahhhhh.....
author: B B.

description: This place is really mini.  If you have more than 2 people you should turn around and go somewhere else.  We waited awhile for a table since we had 3 people.  The sushi was really good though, but I thought a little pricey.  They had a good variety of different rolls.  We tried quite a few and all were delicious.
author: Jaime C.

description: Sushi nuggets are the best here! Love this cute and cozy sushi place! The fish is FRESH and they've always got great music playing. It's only 3 blocks from my place so I never complain about parking, but it is a tough one. They do have two spots reserved for their customers in the driveway. There's one tip!
author: Judi K.

description: This place is great.  It's simple...good fish, great rolls, friendly service.  Done deal.
author: Susan L.

description: OK, so, Sushi Rapture is BY FAR my favorite take-out sushi place. The wait time may be somewhat long, but the customer service is EXCELLENT and the selection plus the actual orders are great. So...why only 3 stars [which is the same rating I gave to a much lower-standard SushiRock]? Well, there's absolutely no reason that the minimum order requirement should be as high as $25. That's absurd. They would get my business weekly if it weren't for that requirement....as it stands, I only order from Sushi Rapture on a very rare occasion. c'mon, rapture, get with it! it's san francisco....people don't want a $25 dinner on Tuesday night! We just want decent takeout...cut it to $15 and I promise to order every week.
author: Johanna S.

description:
Okay I admit it, I'm a sushi snob and I probably have been eating it a lot longer than you. I'm also a local who lives a block an a half from this joint so it was only a matter of time before I tried it. My first experience 6 years ago was not so good. I figure I'd just write it off. Then, about three years ago, I was desperate, so I tried it again. I've been a regular ever since.
Great chef, wonderful staff and, most important of all, very good sushi. Not the best I've ever had, but very good (in the top 5) and fairly priced.
I like my sushi very traditional - one fish, rice and seaweed. I don't go for most of the globby 20 something amateur rolls. That  said, the Sushi Rapture is one of the best combo varieties I've ever tasted. Raw oyster, fresh uni, raw quail yolk, tobiko and shaved green onion. Not for the meek so it's probably not for you. Five stars just for the brilliance of the Rapture!
author: Catherine W.

description: When I lived in Nob Hill I went here a lot.  Sometimes I'll still even make a special little journey back over there to have Sam's sushi.  Sushi Rapture is more like "neighborhood sushi hangout" than a sushi restaurant.  I can see how some may have been turned off by the bantering between Sam and the customers and the tv in the background playing baseball.  I generally get my food to go but if the place isn't too crowded I don't mind the atmosphere that much.  Food is always excellent and the staff is friendly.  Honestly, its the only place I get sushi in this city anymore.  Great quality, good portions, fair prices.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: Checked it out because it's literally down the block from my friend's place, and I was hoping to love it, even if just for the convenience.  But sadly, I was disappointed.  It wasn't that it was bad, it just wasn't great, and I've definitely had better - for cheaper.  The seaweed salad was teeny and a little too fishy for my taste.  Rainbow roll was great, but the other one - I don't even remember what it was but it had spicy tuna in it - definitely was not a fave.  The saving grace for this trip (why this is a 3 and not a 2) was the amazing Agedashi Tofu!  Mmmmm...so good.
author: Irene W.

description: Andrea and Sammy are pure neighborhood goodness.  I love their 49er rolls and the fish fry thing they make.  Sammy always has really good specials going.  Oh, and Andrea has a really cute dog.  Watch out though cos during the day all they do is talk about betting on sports.  It's annoying.
author: Corie W.

description: I'm new to sushi, but this cozy little Nob Hill spot makes me want to make it a more regular part of my routine. Sushi Rapture is small, yet it's never been crowded the few times I've walked by. My date and I had no trouble getting a table on a Saturday night. Service is attentive, the menu is expansive and well priced, and the food is delicious. We had a shrimp scampi appetizer, tuna tataki and a rainbow roll, washed down with Asaki and Sapporo beers. We just missed happy hour, which is offered Thursday through Saturday until 6:30. The happy-hour specials looked great, so I'll be returning soon to check them out.
author: Jason B.

description: I love sushi, so when I moved to Nob Hill and discovered that Sushi Rapture was so close, I had to give it a try.  I decided to order delivery, which came relatively quickly.  Upon opening the box, I recoiled.  The sushi was not fresh and all and had the disgusting overly fishy taste and odor.  I was horribly disappointed and ended up throwing half of it out.  The second time I ordered from them was even worse.  This sushi is terrible and anyone who loves fresh fish should not go here.  Word to the wise- Wasabi and Ginger delivers much better sushi.  Order from them and never, ever go here.
author: Jessica C.

description: Teriyaki chicken.  It was okay.  I ate 1/4 of the chicken in the entree.  Instead I finished the side salad and any granule of rice not soaked with sauce (about a tablespoon worth).  Salty.  Better break out the high blood pressure tablets.  So not worth it.
author: K W.

description: This small place has become my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco. Friendly staff, affordable prices and the best list of sushi and rolls in town. Remember to check out the specials... they are always worth it. The only downside: it is closed on Monday nights.
author: Claudio B.

description:
Surprisingly good little Sushi place.  Food is fresh and hearty.  I usually get my meals to go since it's so close to home.  Great neighborhood dining - it's about the size of my apartment, but makes for cozy and intimate dining.  

I recommend trying items listed on their "Specials" board. The fresh Oyster variety of the day is a treat.  For the less adventurous, the Spider Rainbow Roll is delicious, and the Hamachi Kama is quite tasty.
author: Caryn L.

description: I live super close and go here at least once a month, I would go more if I could afford it. If you live in Nob Hill this should become a staple of your diet. If you like unagi the Cal Rock is awesome, I always get that and then ask Sam, the chef, what he recommends for the day. The cool thing about Sam is that he actually goes and buys the fish everyday so he knows what is really good and fresh for that particular day. Lesser chefs would probably recommend whatever they are trying to get rid of before it goes bad, but what he recommends is always really good and fresh and that keeps me coming back. The E-Rich roll is also awesome if you are a real glutton like myself.
author: Erich G.

description: Cozy little sushi bar on Nob Hill.  The food here wasn't half bad. Not the best sushi bar I've ever been to, but worth a try.  Some dishes are a little better than others.  Interior decor is kind of hip.
author: Eric G.

description: We were excited about Sushi Rapture based on the reviews we had seen, but were sorely disappointed when we finally got to try it out. The edamame was cold and way overcooked (think floppy), the miso soup left much to be desired, and the sushi itself was merely okay, but nothing special. And to top it all off, the service was almost non-existent. Our friend did enjoy the vegetarian rolls, but that was the only highlight of our visit. Based on the other reviews, it seems that we got unlucky, but we won't be going back to Sushi Rapture because there are other, more satisfying options in the area.
author: Michael L.

description: Not bad, but nothing too special. A bit overpriced given that you can get better sushi for cheaper in this city.
author: J K.

description: Good sushi.  Nigiri and maki are fairly standard.  The "special nigiri" deserves recognition for being both different and delicious and many feature quail egg.  I'm a big fan of the "United" special nigiri.  The atmosphere is a bit cramped, but friendly and pleasant.  In addition, delivery to Nob Hill arrives in under 20 minutes.
author: Megan S.

description:
The Sushi is GOOD!  I am always skeptical of any first time at a sushi restaurant, but this was very fresh fish, presented nicely and extremely attentive, yet not annoying, good service. 

The downside is that the place is so brightly lit, I am convinced they would double or triple their business if they just dimmed the lights a little..
author: Keith H.

description:
Yummy sushi, but I've had better.

It's decent-good in my opinion. Not incredible, but not bad either.
author: Nicole R.

description: I love this place. It's a few doors down from my house, so it's very convenient for me to grab dinner there. It's fast, friendly, and delicious. They have great deals, the bento boxes are rad. The girls who work there are all really pretty and helpful. I'm all about this place. Not too pricy either. It's a bit small inside so I wouldn't advise large groups.. great for take out though.
author: Katie M.

description: I haven't had a bad thing yet!  Right around the corner which is nice, so I haven't even tried the delivery.
author: Leslie R.

description: best sushi ever! The most creative rolls, fresh sashimi. Cool staff. A real neighborhood find.
author: Sara R.

description: This place is great for sushi, friendly service and good noodle soup. The specials are excellent and the fish is fresh. I loved the rolls. We have always be able to get in quickly even on the weekends which makes it a great neighborhood place. The only think I would not recommend and why it lost 1 star is the chicken in the noodle soup, not so good. Thankfully the rest of our meal was outstanding.
author: Cbr A.

description: This place is pretty weak. I just went here for the second time today, sat down and asked for a cup of tea. A good first indicator as to the quality of a sushi restaurant is how they serve their tea. Well, the waitress brings out this huge glass cup with a stem - totally inappropriate for drinking a hot cup of tea with my sushi. It had a nasty bitterness to it as well. Ordered agedashi tofu as an appetizer which came quickly - the flavor was right but the texture was off. I got the sushi combo with 6 peices nigiri and a salmon roll. The pieces of fish were unimpressive and the taste was average at best. Not that it was totally unappetizing, but the fish just wasn't fresh enough for my taste. Total came to 22 dollars with tip. Skip this place, save up some money and go to okoze sushi a few blocks away on hyde.
author: Max L.

description: This is the perfect neighborhood sushi spot.  Sushi is delicious, and so are the hot meals - like tasty butter fish on a steaming place.
author: K B.

description:
first of all, this is my first review on yelp in sf (fairly new to the area). i was inspired to write a review tonight because of a couple reviews i read about sub-par chicken at sushi rapture. ummmm, why would you go to a sushi joint for chicken?????? i'm astounded by this! but maybe it's just me?!?

...anyway, the SUSHI (their specialty, as the name not only suggests but states) and service are excellent! Sammy (sushi chef) is extremely personable and speaks english really well (unlike many other asian owned/operated restaurants). i know he knows what i'm asking for and after going with all of his recommendations (esp the creamy roll!!!!), i know that what i order is going to be delish. and fresh. and fast, because naturally for this city it's small but never obnoxiously crowded.

yummy....i'm getting hungry just thinking about it (the sushi, not the chicken...).
author: Claire M.

description: Sushi Rapture is the only place I go for my sushi. Ask for Sammy when you go there, his taste and skill in fish is amazing (gets his fish every morning). Service is always super friendly! Be adventurous and try the Pumpkin roll and the United Nigiri...you will never find that anywhere else....well, I haven't. The Butterfish is no joke. A casual, friendly place where everybody knows your name.
author: DT l.

description: Sushi Rapture is incredible. I've never gone wrong there. The snake roll, United special nigiri, and pickle salad are perfection. Parking in the Nob Hill hood is a pain if you don't live nearby (we used to live down the block), but is worth the hike. Plus, it's fun to check out all the first-daters that come in...trying to impress each other with their chopstick skills.
author: Sarah Y.

description: Great locals place for reasonably priced sushi. Good vibe, good fish, good ppl.
author: Derek D.

description: The best sushi restaurant ever. It's small, cosy, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It's like this hidden nirvana that only the selected privileged few know of. Yes, very bohemian indeed. Great place to bring your dates. And hey, the food's great too. Yumm.... the sweet caramel like melting sensation of the fish meat.... Simply irresistable. (Love it)^infinite.
author: greg d.
